org.smpp.pdu

Class PDU

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.smpp.SmppObject
      • org.smpp.pdu.ByteData
        • org.smpp.pdu.PDU
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Request, Response

    public abstract class PDU
extends ByteData
    Class PDU is abstract base class for all classes which represent a PDU. It contains methods for manipulating PDU header, checking validity of PDU, automatic parsing and generation of optional part of PDU, methods for creating instance of proper class representing certain PDU based only in command id, methods for detection if the PDU is request or response PDU, automatic sequence number assignment, etc. It also implements setData and getData methods as the header and optional params parsing and composition is the same for all PDUs. The derived classes on turn implement functions setBody and getBody.

    The PDU has two descendants, Request and Response, which serve as a base classes for concrete PDU classes like SubmitSM, SubmitSMResp etc.

    Version:
    $Revision: 1.9 $
    Author:
    Logica Mobile Networks SMPP Open Source Team

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte VALID_ALL
      This constant indicates that parsing of the buffer passed all parts of the PDU, i.e. headet, mandator and optional parameters.
      static byte VALID_BODY
      This constant indicates that parsing of the buffer passed parsing of the mandatory part of body of PDU but failed parsing of optional parameters.
      static byte VALID_HEADER
      This constant indicates that parsing of the buffer passed parsing of the header of PDU but failed parsing of mandatory part of body.
      static byte VALID_NONE
      This constant indicates that parsing of the buffer failed parsing of the header of PDU.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PDU

        public PDU()
        Default constructor, what else.

      • PDU

        public PDU(int commandId)
        Initialises PDU with given command id. Derived classes should provide correct command id for their type, e.g. SubmitSM should provide Data.SUBMIT_SM, which is equal to 4 (as defined in SMPP 3.4 spec.)
        Parameters:
        commandId - the numerical id of the PDU as specified in SMPP specification

    • Method Detail

      • setBody

        public void setBody(ByteBuffer buffer)
             throws NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException,
                    TerminatingZeroNotFoundException,
                    PDUException
        Default method for seting mandatory parameters of the PDU. Derived classes should overwrite this method if they want to fill their member variables with data from the binary data buffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer with the PDU's data as received from SMSC
        Throws:
        NotEnoughDataInByteBufferException
        TerminatingZeroNotFoundException
        PDUException
        See Also:
        setData(ByteBuffer)

      • getBody

        public ByteBuffer getBody()
                   throws ValueNotSetException
        Default method for composing binary representation of the mandatory part of the PDU. Derived classes should overwrite this method with composition of buffer from their member variables.
        Throws:
        ValueNotSetException
        See Also:
        getData()

      • canResponse

        public boolean canResponse()
        This method indicates that the object represents PDU which can and should be responded to. For example for SubmitSM class this should return true, while for SubmitSMResp or AlertNotification classes this should return false. This method is overwritten in class Request as most "request" PDUs have response counterparts. (Exception to this rule is above mentioned AlertNotification which doesn't have response.)
        Returns:
        if the PDU can have a response
        See Also:
        Request.canResponse(), Response.canResponse(), AlertNotification.canResponse()

      • isRequest

        public abstract boolean isRequest()
        Returns if the object represents PDU which is a request. E.g. classes derived from Request class return true.
        Returns:
        if the PDU represents request

      • isResponse

        public abstract boolean isResponse()
        Returns if the object represents PDU which is response. E.g. classes derived from Response class return true.
        Returns:
        if the PDU represents response

      • assignSequenceNumber

        public void assignSequenceNumber()
        Assigns newly generated sequence number if the sequence number hasn't been assigned yet. Doesn't have any effect if the sequence number was already assigned.
        See Also:
        assignSequenceNumber(boolean), setSequenceNumber(int), setHeader(ByteBuffer)

      • assignSequenceNumber

        public void assignSequenceNumber(boolean always)
        Assigns newly generated sequence number. If the sequence number was previously set by setSequenceNumber method or from byte buffer in setHeader, this method only assigns the number if the parameter always is true.
        Parameters:
        always - if the number has to be assigned even if it was already assigned
        See Also:
        setSequenceNumber(int), setHeader(ByteBuffer)

      • resetSequenceNumber

        public void resetSequenceNumber()
        If the sequence number was previously set to a value, this function resets that fact. I.e. if the PDU is re-used for another say submit, then after calling of this function a new sequence number will assigned to it the PDU despite of the fact that there was another one assigned to it before.

      • setData

        public void setData(ByteBuffer buffer)
             throws InvalidPDUException,
                    PDUException
        Parses the binary buffer to get the PDUs header, fields from mandatory part and fields from the optional part.
        The header and optional part are parsed common way for all PDUs using functions setHeader and setOptionalBody the mandatory body is parsed by the derived classes in setBody function. If parsing throws an exception, the PDU's getValid function returns the phase which was correct last.
        The buffer can contain more than one PDU, then only one PDU is taken from the buffer and the rest remains unaltered.
        Specified by:
        setData in class ByteData
        Parameters:
        buffer - the buffer containg the PDU binary data which are source for the content of the fields of this PDU
        Throws:
        PDUException - some data in the buffer were invalid
        InvalidPDUException
        See Also:
        setHeader(ByteBuffer), setBody(ByteBuffer), setOptionalBody(ByteBuffer), getValid(), getData()

      • getData

        public ByteBuffer getData()
                   throws ValueNotSetException
        Construct the binary PDU for sending to SMSC. First creates the mandatory part using getBody method, which has to be implemented in the derived classes (if they represent PDU with body), then creates the optional part of the PDU using getOptionalBody, which is common for all PDUs. Calculates the size of the PDU and then creates the header using getHeader and returns the full binary PDU.
        Specified by:
        getData in class ByteData
        Returns:
        the binary data buffer created from member variables
        Throws:
        ValueNotSetException - thrown from a TLV if the value was requested but never set
        See Also:
        getBody(), getOptionalBody(Vector), getHeader(), setData(ByteBuffer)

      • setValid

        public void setValid(byte valid)
        Sets if the PDU contains correctly formated data.

      • getValid

        public byte getValid()
        Returns if the PDU contains correctly formated data.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Returns if the parsing of the binary PDU data successfully parsed complete PDU.

      • isInvalid

        public boolean isInvalid()
        Returns if the parsing of the binary PDU data ended before parsing of the header.

      • isHeaderValid

        public boolean isHeaderValid()
        Returns if at least the header of the binary PDU data was correct.

      • registerOptional

        protected void registerOptional(TLV tlv)
        Registeres a TLV as an optional parameter which can be containd in the PDU. Derived classes are expected that they will define appropriate TLVs and register them using this method. Only registered TLVs can be read as optional parameters from binary PDU received from SMSC.
        Parameters:
        tlv - the TLV to be registered as an optional parameter
        See Also:
        TLV

      • registerExtraOptional

        protected void registerExtraOptional(TLV tlv)
        Registeres a TLV as an extra optional parameter which can be contained in the PDU. Extra optional parameter is TLV not defined in SMPP spec. The reason for this method is that if you know what type and size certain extra optional parameter has to be, then you can create an instance of appropriate TLV class, e.g. TLVInt class and register it as the carrying TLV instead of using the generic TLVOctets class.
        Parameters:
        tlv - the TLV to be registered as an extra optional parameter
        See Also:
        TLV

      • setExtraOptional

        public void setExtraOptional(TLV tlv)
        Sets the extra optional parameter.

      • setExtraOptional

        public void setExtraOptional(short tag,
                             ByteBuffer data)
                      throws TLVException
        Creates new generic extra optional parameter with tag and data provided; uses TLVOctets for the parameter.
        Throws:
        TLVException

      • getExtraOptional

        public TLV getExtraOptional(short tag)
        Finds and returns extra optional parameter with the provided tag; if not found returns null.

      • getCommandLength

        public int getCommandLength()
        Returns the length of this PDU. The length is only valid if you probe the PDU which was parsed from binary data received from SMSC. If you created the PDU and filled in the filds of the PDU, the length returned by this function will be very likely incorrect.

      • getCommandId

        public int getCommandId()
        Returns the command id of the PDU object. The command id can be either read from the binary data received from SMSC or can be set by derived class as the command id of the PDU which is represented by the class.

      • getCommandStatus

        public int getCommandStatus()
        Returns the command status of the PDU.

      • getSequenceNumber

        public int getSequenceNumber()
        Returns the sequence number of the PDU. If the PDU is created by yourself and not parsed from binary data received from SMSC, then the sequence number will be very likely incorrect until you didn't set it previously by calling function assignSequenceNumber or setSequenceNumber.
        See Also:
        assignSequenceNumber(), setSequenceNumber(int)

      • setCommandLength

        public void setCommandLength(int cmdLen)
        Sets the length of the PDU. Don't do it manually, it won't have any wffect.

      • setCommandId

        public void setCommandId(int cmdId)
        Sets the command id.

      • setCommandStatus

        public void setCommandStatus(int cmdStatus)
        Sets the command status, i.e. error status of the PDU.

      • setSequenceNumber

        public void setSequenceNumber(int seqNr)
        Sets the sequence number of the PDU. For PDUs whic are about to be sent to SMSC the sequence number is generated automatically in the Transmitter class and under normal cicumstances there is no need to set it explicitly.

      • isOk

        public boolean isOk()
        If the command status of the PDU is ESME_ROK.

      • isGNack

        public boolean isGNack()
        If the PDU carries generic_nack despite of the class of the object.
        Under some wierd conditions there is need to "encapsulate" generic negative acknowledge information into instance of class different from GenericNack class. For example synchronous call to the Session's submit method should return instance of SubmitSMResp class. If the from some reason the SMSC returns generic_nack as a response to the submit_sm, then the library must somehow overcome the type checking for the return type and thus it creates instance of SubmitSMResp but then it sets the command id the id for generic_nack.
        Returns:
        of the object carries generic_nack pdu rather than pdu as could be indicated from the object's class
        See Also:
        Session.checkResponse(PDU,Response)

      • createPDU

        public static final PDU createPDU(ByteBuffer buffer)
                           throws HeaderIncompleteException,
                                  MessageIncompleteException,
                                  UnknownCommandIdException,
                                  InvalidPDUException,
                                  TLVException,
                                  PDUException
        This method gets the buffer and returns an instance of class corresponding to the type of the PDU which was in the buffer; the fields of the returned PDU are set to the data from the buffer.
        Cool, isn't it.
        Throws:
        HeaderIncompleteException
        MessageIncompleteException
        UnknownCommandIdException
        InvalidPDUException
        TLVException
        PDUException
        See Also:
        createPDU(int)

      • createPDU

        public static final PDU createPDU(int commandId)
        Creates an empty instance of class which represents the PDU with given command id.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object object)
        Compares two PDU. Two PDUs are equal if their sequence number is equal ( and now, if their command ids match as well).
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • setApplicationSpecificInfo

        public void setApplicationSpecificInfo(Object key,
                                       Object value)
        Sets the PDU extra information value with key key. This information is not sent anywhere nor the library uses this information in any means. It's intended for use by applicaitons to pass information about the PDU from one part of the application to another without need of extra PDU management.

      • setApplicationSpecificInfo

        public void setApplicationSpecificInfo(Dictionary<Object,Object> applicationSpecificInfo)
        Sets the PDU extra information as a copy of existing Dictionary. The Dictionary is shallow copied, i.e. new container is created for the PDU and elements are put into the new container without copying.
        See Also:
        setApplicationSpecificInfo(Object,Object), cloneApplicationSpecificInfo(Dictionary)

      • getApplicationSpecificInfo

        public Object getApplicationSpecificInfo(Object key)
        Returns extra information with key key. If the information is not found for this PDU, returns null.
        See Also:
        setApplicationSpecificInfo(Object,Object)

      • getApplicationSpecificInfo

        public Dictionary<Object,Object> getApplicationSpecificInfo()
        Returns all the extra information related to this PDU. If there is no information found for this PDU, returns null.
        See Also:
        setApplicationSpecificInfo(Object,Object)

      • removeApplicationSpecificInfo

        public void removeApplicationSpecificInfo(Object key)
        Removes an extra information with the given key from this PDU.
        See Also:
        setApplicationSpecificInfo(Object,Object)
